definition: terminal bud (growing at the tip of a plant)

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: A regeneration system of plantlets was established with apical bud of Acer negundo L.
sentences.chinese: 初步建立了複葉槭頂芽組培再生體系。

sentences.english: The tissue culture of the Netherlands cucumber was studied by using the asepsis seeding of apical buds as the explants.
sentences.chinese: 以荷蘭青瓜無菌苗的頂芽爲外植體進行組織培養。

sentences.english: The terminal bud continues vegetative activity during most of the growing season.
sentences.chinese: 在大部分生長季節，這種莖的頂芽繼續着植物的生長。

sentences.english: All the pear buds tested in Taipei area began to sprout from late-April to early-May.
sentences.chinese: 不論頂芽及側芽，均在四月底到五月初開始萌發。

sentences.english: The explanation begins with the apical bud.
The terminal bud is better than axillary bud for its lower browning rate .
sentences.chinese: 下部腋生枝條頂芽作外植體比其他部位取材褐變率低。

sentences.english: The disinfection efficiency of top bud was better than the others.
sentences.chinese: 以頂芽爲外植體時，外植體的消毒效果最好。

sentences.english: Selection from progeny of terminal bud propagation.
sentences.chinese: 從頂芽繁殖後代中選育。

sentences.english: The buds release this hormone down the plant stem.
sentences.chinese: 頂芽將生長素釋放至植株莖部。
